Package camzup.pfriendly

Interface ITextDisplay

All Known Subinterfaces:
ITextDisplay2, ITextDisplay3
All Known Implementing Classes:
Up3, Yup2, Yup3, YupJ2, Zup3
public interface ITextDisplay
Maintains consistent behavior between renderers which display text to the screen.

    • text

      void text(char[] chars, int start, int stop, float x, float y)
      Displays an array of characters as text at a location.
      Parameters:
      chars - the character array
      start - the start index, inclusive
      stop - the stop index, exclusive
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate

    • text

      default void text(float real, float x, float y)
      Displays a real number as text at a location. Registers up to four decimal places.
      Parameters:
      real - the real number
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      See Also:
      • Utils.toFixed(float, int)

    • text

      default void text(float real, Vec2 v)
      Displays a number as text at a location. Registers up to four decimal places.
      Parameters:
      real - the real number
      v - the location
      See Also:
      • Utils.toFixed(float, int)

    • text

      default void text(int integer, float x, float y)
      Displays a real number at a 2D location. Fixes the number display to four decimal places.
      Parameters:
      integer - the integer
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      See Also:
      • Utils.toPadded(int, int)

    • text

      default void text(Object obj, float x, float y)
      Displays an object as text at a location. Calls the object's toString function.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate

    • text

      default void text(String str, float x, float y)
      Displays a string at a location.
      Parameters:
      str - the string
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate

    • text

      default void text(String str, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2)
      Displays a string at a location. This version of text is not supported, so only x1 and y1 are used.
      Parameters:
      str - the string
      x1 - the x coordinate
      y1 - the y coordinate
      x2 - the second x coordinate
      y2 - the second y coordinate

    • text

      default void text(String str, Vec2 v)
      Displays a string at a location.
      Parameters:
      str - the string
      v - the location
